dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so you know all that talk about the Facebook ad boycott? Civil rights groups, like, pushing for it, hundreds of companies joining in?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so you know all that talk about the Facebook ad boycott? Civil rights groups, like, pushing for it, hundreds of companies joining in?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With over 500 companies having now joined the advertising boycott of Facebook called for by top civil rights groups...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely. I thought that was supposed to really hit them hard, you know, impact their bottom line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely. I thought that was supposed to really hit them hard, you know, impact their bottom line.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, get this. It's actually led to their revenue *soaring*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, get this. It's actually led to their revenue soaring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...most Wall Street firms estimate that Facebook is still looking at less than a 5% hit to overall revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wait, soaring? Seriously? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, soaring? Seriously? How does that even make sense?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's wild. Wall Street analysts are predicting, um, over a five percent jump in revenue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's wild. Wall Street analysts are predicting, um, over a five percent jump in revenue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue, said Rohit Kulkarni, an analyst for MKM Partners, in a recent note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Five percent? For a company that size, that's huge. What happened? Did other companies just, like, swoop in?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five percent? For a company that size, that's huge. What happened? Did other companies just, like, swoop in?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Last Friday, their shares surged eight percent because brands like Pfizer, Lego, even Dunkin' Donuts actually *increased* their ad spending.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Last Friday, their shares surged eight percent because brands like Pfizer, Lego, even Dunkin' Donuts actually increased their ad spending.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook shares initially plunged by 8% last Friday amid an increasing number of big brandsmost recently joined by Pfizer, Lego and Dunkin Donutsannouncing that they will stop working with the tech giant...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So the #StopHateforProfits campaign, which was meant to drive profits down, totally backfired?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the Stop Hate for Profits campaign, which was meant to drive profits down, totally backfired?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah. Completely. It now includes over 500 advertisers who are, like, eager to partner with Facebook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah. Completely. It now includes over five hundred advertisers who are, like, eager to partner with Facebook.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the #StopHateforProfits campaign, which has now grown to include more than 500 advertisers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's incredible. So instead of a hit, they're looking at a boost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's incredible. So instead of a hit, they're looking at a boost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A big one. Rohit Kulkarni, an analyst, said more than five percent. And Morgan Stanley even estimated that if they just gain business from their top 100 advertisers, that's a billion-dollar boost *per month*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A big one. Rohit Kulkarni, an analyst, said more than five percent. And Morgan Stanley even estimated that if they just gain business from their top one hundred advertisers, that's a billion-dollar boost per month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue, said Rohit Kulkarni... In a scenario where the company loses business from its top 100 advertisers, that would only be around a $1 billion hit to revenue per month, Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak estimates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A billion a month? Wow. So, how did they manage to just brush off the boycott then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A billion a month? Wow. So, how did they manage to just brush off the boycott then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Kulkarni noted that advertisers were already ramping up spending because of the pandemic. But also, Facebook has such a diverse revenue base, like millions of paying advertisers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Kulkarni noted that advertisers were already ramping up spending because of the pandemic. But also, Facebook has such a diverse revenue base, like millions of paying advertisers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Advertisers were already winding down spending amid the coronavirus pandemic, Kulkarni notes, but Facebook has a diverse revenue base, with millions of paying advertisers...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So losing a few hundred, even big ones, barely registers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So losing a few hundred, even big ones, barely registers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Procter & Gamble, the world's largest advertiser, apparently accounts for less than half a percent of Facebook's total revenue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Procter and Gamble, the world's largest advertiser, apparently accounts for less than half a percent of Facebook's total revenue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Procter & Gamble, for example, is the largest advertiser in the world but is estimated to account for less than 0.50% of Facebooks revenues, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's just wild. So basically, this whole boycott just highlighted how incredibly resilient Facebook is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just wild. So basically, this whole boycott just highlighted how incredibly resilient Facebook is.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Yeah, like, even when people try to hit them where it hurts, it just seems to make them stronger, uh, financially at least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, even when people try to hit them where it hurts, it just seems to make them stronger, uh, financially at least.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a surprising outcome. Makes you wonder about the real impact of these campaigns sometimes, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a surprising outcome. Makes you wonder about the real impact of these campaigns sometimes, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. A real head-scratcher for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. A real head-scratcher for sure.
